page.title: 05Barrington village school 2
page.content: Barrington school in the 1950s was very different from today. There are two teachers. One class in the hall and one where the library is now. The headteacher lived in the school house with her family. The school had no central heating, heat came from a huge black coke burning stove, enclosed by a large guard. The county library kept books in a hall cupboard for weekly withdrawals. Lessons seemed much more serious and every year we had a nature project studying a tree and a bird. A certificate was awarded for the best. There were no games only Physical Training, no swimming as there was no school pool. Playtimes were spent on the playground as there was no playing field. There was no tapped water only a pump, no flush toilets, only Elsan ones in a hut behind a big hedge where the mobile classroom now stands.
